text: Thanks <@U26BLKGE4>. I take your point. It makes sense operationally, but there is also a reality in which several IT companies and Enterprise clients still rely on IP's for whitelisting, etc, and this issue is also somewhat unique to HubSpot as a "host," which other hosting providers do not have an issue providing. That's really all I was getting at. The good new is that I may have found a workaround anyway because HubSpot does provide a static IP if you attach a root domain in CMS Enterprise. It's not 100% full-proof and it's not "dedicated" but it is static, which helps in these types of situations. Just thought I would pass along in case it was ever useful to you. Thanks again!

I get you, I just think it’s a classic case of the market outpacing IT processes. I’d imagine the same issue would be found on platforms like Shopify, WebFlow, SquareSpace and other “CMSaaS” services.

add custom code/css to your page. If you’re using a drag and drop page, then the only gradient possible on a section is a linear one – so you’ll have to go to the page’s settings -> advanced -> head code and add custom css there
is there a channel for the custom quote themes beta? Trying to understand how the SUBTOTAL (Manual Input) works
Set 404 template in settings and share live HS domain link <http://www.xyz.com/404|www.xyz.com/404>
